Official Website: http://squidsoft.net
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Humanity has just emerged from the lowest point in its collective history, and
the closest it has been to extinction since the advent of agriculture. By the
year 2304, the Coalition of humans and their alien allies the Jinu has spread
across the stars, and thought themselves powerful. But the Outsiders, an alien
empire occupying vast reaches of Rimward space, proved them wrong. First contact
between the two allies was severed, and suddenly humanity was alone. Then the
Outsiders attacked in force, and human planets and governments fell one by one.
                         It was the apocalypse.
But contrary to the beliefs of many, not all hope was lost. After five years,
a single starship, the Percival Lowell, returned from Rimward space, bringing
with it the means to nullify the Outsiders' greatest weapon. With this, and the
help of many other brave pilots, the occupying Outsiders were driven off human
               worlds and back to where they came from.
 Humanity is now trying to rebuild, and trying to regain what it has lost. The
Outsiders are finished with occupation, and now desire only to see humans
extinct.
New threats and new mysteries seem to appear every day. In the midst of it all,
civilian starships span the stars, maintaining an open threat against any new
       invasion and trying to make a few credits while they're at it.
You too have felt the lure of this; the desire for a unique freedom that most
citizens will never know, the drive to explore, the need to defend your species,
         and yes, greed for the vast wealth that is to be had.
                   It is time to take to the stars.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to the original and still the most innovative pulp science fiction
multiplayer roleplaying adventure!
Originally opened in its classic form on 19 December 1998! Reopened in its new
iteration on 28 February 2009!
All original work (including setting, non-player characters, design, source
code, all related background material, and all text) located in this game or on
the Squidsoft.net website is copyright (c) Squidsoft.net 1998-2015. Unauthorised
reproduction prohibited.
Warning: Speech in this game is largely uncensored, and sensitive individuals
may find some other players offensive. The staff is ultimately not responsible
for the words and actions of the players.
The last server reset was at Fri Jul 22 13:40:17 2016 UTC
We're on Twitter! @StarConquest for server status notifications and out-of-game
contact!
No new announcements to display.

If you do not yet have a Squidsoft.net account, type CREATE or visit the above
web address.

    * Welcome to Star Conquest! *
[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, an
insulated green cooler, a clear plastic food storage container, Purr the
humanoid service robot, and Shasta the big onyx soldier felo here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

looking up at you adoringly.

It is filled with water.

blue egg.

A short violet soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles, a small
sleek speckled amber aquatic creature with pentagonal fins, a large sleek
speckled amber aquatic creature with hexagonal fins, a tiny sleek speckled amber
aquatic creature with fan-like fins, a large sleek speckled amber aquatic
creature with pentagonal fins, a tiny sleek speckled amber aquatic creature with
pentagonal fins, a large sleek speckled amber aquatic creature with pentagonal
fins, a small sleek speckled amber aquatic creature with rounded fins, a small
sleek speckled amber aquatic creature with pentagonal fins, a small sleek
speckled amber aquatic creature with fan-like fins, a tiny sleek speckled amber
aquatic creature with pentagonal fins, a large sleek speckled amber aquatic
creature with hexagonal fins, a small sleek speckled violet aquatic creature
with frilled fins, a small sleek speckled amber aquatic creature with rounded
fins, and a tiny sleek speckled amber aquatic creature with fan-like fins are
living in it.
That's fifteen creatures, and it looks pretty crowded.

[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a rug
woven of large dark green fern fronds, a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo chow
bowl, a personal hoverpallet, a luxuriously soft oval amethyst rug with a gold
fleur-de-lys in the center and thick gold fringe, and Shasta the big onyx
soldier felo here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.

[Old Frontier Processor; Asteroid Mining]
You see a large leather couch, a coffee table of highly polished lunar basalt,
and a small natural golden brown trash bin here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large leather couch.

Lily Kaise cuddles up to you.
sit couch

Lily Kaise exclaims in a New Earth accent, "Hey!"
cudle lily

cuddle lily

smile lily 'Hi!

Lily Kaise smiles at you.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Not too much left on this."
grin

'I did.

grin
You grin.
Lily Kaise grins at you.
kiss lily on lips

squeeze lily
You squeeze Lily Kaise affectionately.
Lily Kaise squeezes you affectionately.
smile
You smile.
caress lily on back
You gently caress Lily Kaise's back.
Lily says to you in a New Earth accent, "You doind all right?"
nod and smile 'I'm doing great.
You nod and smile. "I'm doing great."
peer n
You peer north...
[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine here.
You can go north, northeast, south, northwest, and up.
Lily Kaise gently caresses your neck and shoulders.
smile
You smile.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Ok."
Lily Kaise exclaims in a New Earth accent, "Have a big fight going on just as
I'm about out of ore!"
Lily Kaise laughs.
laugh
You laugh.
[General Communication] Damien Goss transmits, "Shule can you come to accord?"
tra gen Sure.

Lily says to you in a New Earth accent, "Go ahead."
Lily Kaise grins.
'be right back
You say, "Be right back."
grin
You grin.
Lily Kaise nods.
n
You scramble to your feet.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "William Dove, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
tra gen What's up?
[General Communication] Shule Elemmire transmits, "What's up?"
ftl accord
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
[General Communication] Damien Goss transmits, "Well since there are no cats
available we are going to put a processor at 134 but we have to rearrange things
a little for best effect."
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
Via general sector communication, Accord of Free Worlds Command transmits,
"Hello, William Dove. Welcome to Accord space."
move
AutoStar detects 3 possible destinations.  Assembling destination list.  Please
wait.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, an

humanoid service robot here.

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
This asteroid belt is unusually close to its star, and the slowly rotating
asteroids glitter brightly in the sunlight.
Via general sector communication, Space Station Delta transmits, "Hello there,

watchtower.

A voice comes over the speaker and says, "RockIt!, you have clearance to launch.
Good luck and come back to us safely."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:

wrap lily
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
You wrap your arms around Lily Kaise, pulling her close.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 3123 light-minutes per second from Galactic
Eastsoutheast and Very Slightly Down."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'RockIt!.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
Lily Kaise transfers a toll payment to a local rift accelerator.
[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has received 1,447,034.58 EAOS
credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating Solar Toll Station in
The Belt of Orion.
The computer announces, "Setting course to Asteroid Beacon Nu 465. Local rift
accelerator with matching vector found."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
A fiery cloud of pyroclastic ash roars through the starship, burning the walls
away. When it passes, the ship is a drifting platform hovering through a barren
hellscape covered in ash. A volcano spews ash and fire into the blackened sky as
glowing lava flows down its sides. The scorched remains of trees, animals, and
humans caught in the blast litter the ground.
[General Communication] Keegan Wantz transmits, "Megapod raid beginning now."
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Not bad."

[Starship "RockIt!"; Control Room]
A barren hellscape covered in ash stretches on for miles in all directions. Off
on the horizon, a massive volcano is spewing ash and fire into the blackened sky
from its crater, and glowing lava flows cover the mountain. The scorched remains
of trees, animals, and humans litter ground. Lights overhead indicate that the
ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is
inside the riftflow.

[Rocky Asteroid Surface]
You stand on a barren grey surface. Craters, rocks, and small pockets of dust
are all that break the monotony.
The two-person hardened asteroid hauler "RockIt!" is parked here.
You can go north, south, east, west, northeast, northwest, southeast, and
southwest.
A large blue soldier felo kitten marches out.
l
[Starship "RockIt!"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at Rocky Asteroid Surface.
You see a small lavender trash bin, a glossy violet ceramic felo chow bowl,
Daizey the humanoid service robot, a big blue sabre-toothed felo, a big blue
cyclops felo, and a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow with thick
gold fringe here.
Lily Kaise is sitting on a large purple and lavender paisley floor pillow.
You can go up and out.

gold fringe.)

[Starship "RockIt!"; Control Room]

Lily Kaise presses a button to deploy the ship's anchor.
A sharp crack is heard throughout the ship as the anchors on either side deploy
with explosive force, biting deep into the surface of the asteroid.
The ship's engines fire, and the anchored asteroid gradually begins to move
toward League Asteroid Processing Nuclear Temporary Station.
The computer reports that the asteroid is approximately two sectors from its
destination.

with explosive force, biting deep into the surface of the asteroid.

briefs, and a pair of black socks. You are also wearing a keychain, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a gold wrist-mounted
chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator, a solid silver ring
engraved with dolphins, a black guitar case, a backpack, a reactionless
spacesuit jet, and a spacesuit navaid. You are concealing a golden Feng Wo coin
purse, a black flightbag with a red shooting star on the side, a camera bag, an
asteroid hauling supply kit, a flight control scanner, a large expandable
telescoping xenology container, a black engineering tool case, a thick
synthleather bandolier with large pockets, a scorched metal thigh holster, and a
leather briefcase. Your head, face, both eyes, and neck are left uncovered.

anchor in your left hand.

As the asteroid falls into the station's collection bay, your ship detaches and
heads for the docking bay.
You receive 28,083,469.71 League credits for this asteroid!
Your income is deferred until the temporary station's storage module is
transferred to a spaceport.
[Notification from Starseekers] An asteroid has been received at League Asteroid
Processing Nuclear Temporary Station from the two-person hardened asteroid
hauler "RockIt!". The organization has earned 2,222,825.66 credits.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Oh Ali sent me an interrupt for when I
craftet his beacon autostop."
Lily Kaise scrambles to her feet.
Lily Kaise glides out.

use kit
You press a button on an asteroid hauling supply kit, and it quickly extends a
number of tiny robotic arms and grabs every asteroid hauling related implement
registered to you in the area.
Your asteroid hauling supply kit grabs an asteroid anchor with its tiny robotic
manipulator arms and stows it away.

manipulator arms and stows it away.

extends a number of tiny robotic arms and grabs every asteroid hauling related
implement registered to her in the area.
Lily Kaise's asteroid hauling supply kit grabs an asteroid anchor with its tiny
robotic manipulator arms and stows it away.

robotic manipulator arms and stows it away.

its tiny robotic manipulator arms and stows it away.

line with its tiny robotic manipulator arms and stows it away.
Your asteroid hauling supply kit's tiny robotic manipulator arms, apparently
satisfied with a job well done, suddenly retract back into the kit.
Lily Kaise's asteroid hauling supply kit's tiny robotic manipulator arms,
apparently satisfied with a job well done, suddenly retract back into the kit.

Kaise boards it. They flash again as the airlock closes.

cycle

A small light on the airlock control panel turns from green to yellow. Through
your suit, you hear the hiss of air quickly leaving the airlock.

for another four days out here."
The hiss of air slowly fades away into nothingness, and the yellow light becomes
red.

use anchor

anchor seeks the best angle downwards.
(17 seconds roundtime.)

ground.  You feel vibrations through your boots as the anchor secures itself in
the surface of the asteroid.

and decide to move on to the next step.

green.

l big
a big blue soldier felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely wolf-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped blue fur,
possessing a short, thin tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
long, thin legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, hooked black claws,
visible only when not retracted. A orange, square nose sits below a pair of
clear indigo eyes with horizontal pupils.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a sleeveless pastel purple cotton top with a three-button front
and v-neck trimmed with tiny embroidered flowers, a pair of white capri pants,
and a pair of mystic purple suede clogs. She is also wearing an orange and white
blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling
silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid
silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire and small
purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple
reinforced plastic phone holster, and a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly
labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms,
both wrists, both hands, both knees, both calves, and both ankles are left
uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.
Lily Kaise stands up from a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made
white and sapphire star quilt on it.
A medium-sized semi-transparent cylindrical creature with long dangling tendrils
and a chartreuse glowing interior pulsates gently.

Asteria. The lizard's tongue flicks out once, then its head lunges forward,
snapping up the food in a sudden blur and immediately swallowing it whole.

[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a white four poster
rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a
set of lavender silk sheets, a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made
purple and amethyst flower quilt, a large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large
periwinkle bed pillow on it, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth
rug, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top, and a small yellow
ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.

l me
Shule Elemmire
He appears to be 26 years old. He is about six feet and two inches tall and has
olive skin. His body is athletic with muscled hips and strong calves. He has
average-sized shoulders and a wide chest. His face is average-shaped and
handsome, with a broad nose and strong chin. His lips are thin and tan and
occasionally part to reveal a set of fairly white teeth. Beneath a set of arched
eyebrows, his eyes are blue-grey and round. His shoulder-length, straight hair
is blonde and neatly trimmed over the ears and parted on the side. He has large
brownish fingernails.
 He is wearing a soft Bahama blue cotton polo, a pair of slim Sahara sand linen
trousers, and a pair of washed light khaki canvas sneakers. He is also wearing a
keychain, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a black leather phone holster, a
gold wrist-mounted chronometer, a metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator,
a solid silver ring engraved with dolphins, a black guitar case, and a backpack.
His head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both wrists, and
both hands are left uncovered.
He is carrying nothing.

l
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, a shiny chrome trash bin, Fabious the arachnoid security robot, and
Nemesis the large steel sabre-toothed felo here.
Joel Kringle, Demarco Scott, Evenia Callseah, Ted Warburton, Sakura Arakida,
Lily Kaise, and Damien Alexander are standing here.
You can go out.
Lily Kaise takes a bite of a large wedge of coffee cake topped with apple
streusel.
Lily Kaise takes a sip of a cup of hot French vanilla coffee.
wave
You wave.
Evenia says to Damien, "Have fun."

followed you.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The six-person A.S.S. frigate "Emerald McKay", the five-person pulsar "Critical
Strike", and the two-person Accord gemini "Hawthorne's Gyrfalcon" are landed
here.
You see an automatic teller machine, a small trash can, and a sanitation drone
here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair with Jewel the sleeping
large violet glowing felo on it, a large oval white and black cloth rug, a rare
black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and sapphire star quilt on
it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon
purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and coral rocks, a
small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a small white
trash bin, a clear plastic food storage container, Purr the humanoid service
robot, a compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, and a
round white rattan coffee table with a glass top here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair with Jewel the sleeping
large violet glowing felo on it, a large oval white and black cloth rug, a rare
black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and sapphire star quilt on
it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized bubbling neon
purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and coral rocks, a
small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a small white
trash bin, a clear plastic food storage container, Purr the humanoid service
robot, a compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container, and a
round white rattan coffee table with a glass top here.
You can go south and out.
(You are sitting on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white
and sapphire star quilt on it.)

rattan bench with a long white and coral pink flowered cushion on it, a rattan

rattan pantry cabinet, a white microwave oven, a small purple ball containing a
dingling bell, a glossy slate blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a shiny red deluxe
rice cooker with a golden dragon on top, a small hot tea dispenser, and Shasta
the big onyx soldier felo here.

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.

sit chair
You sit down on a black leather captain's chair.
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

ftl accord
sit chair
You sit down on a black leather captain's chair.
A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.
Via general sector communication, Accord of Free Worlds Command transmits,
"Hello, Critical Strike. Welcome to Accord space."

l
[Starship "Courageous"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is in a garage.
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go down and out.
(You are sitting.)
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Courageous, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

ftl sector 11
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
Via general sector communication, Sector 11 Outpost transmits in a robotic
voice, "Detecting vessel 'Courageous.' Welcome to Sector 11."

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

[New Earth; Spaceport East]
This area is full of side shops and cafes, though most of them are closed right
now. A star taxi waiting room is to the north, and a sign points west to the
central area of the spaceport. Nearly hidden among a cluster of potted plants on
the south side of the concourse, a dim neon sign hangs over the entrance to the
Spaceport Cantina, the local watering hole. The landing pad is to the east. This
area of the spaceport, usually bustling with activity, is strangely empty.
You can go north, east, south, and west.

[Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay Two]
This is a fully modern docking bay, made of the same sleek, slightly darkened
metal that the exterior of the station is made from. Brightly painted yellow
lines mark entry and exit paths for ships, and rows of dotted lines indicate
where ships may touch down. A series of electromagnetic manipulators prevent
atmosphere from escaping into space when the bay door is opened. One wall shows
a telltale pair of flat dents from an out-of-control forklift. A ramp leads up
to the rest of the station.
The two-person tugboat "Gentle Push", the reconnaissance craft "Sg 10", the
two-person isotope "Wing Of Glory", the two-person light transport "Agony", the
four-person Accord space module transport "All The Canine", and the five-person
hammerhead "Akrep" are landed here.
You can go southwest, northwest, and up.

Lily Kaise glides south.

[Starship "Akrep"; Weapons Room Three]
Unlike the control room, a starship's weapon room has only one tiny viewport.
The focus of the room is a slightly miniaturized starmap, augmented with
additional spatial relationship information and various status displays. A
streamlined control board sits before the starmap, with prominent indicators for
lock status and weapon readiness. Control boards for the ship's weaponry are off
to either side, to be pulled into place at a moment's notice. Lights overhead
indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see
that the ship is in space.

bonus of 2,250,000.00 AEU credits, plus an enemy magnitude bonus of 400,000.00
AEU credits.

battle analysis scanner on a temporary space station.

[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has gained 5,511,232.38 credits
for a submission from a battle analysis scanner on League Battle-Scanning
Nuclear Temporary Station involving the five-person hammerhead "Akrep".
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.

powered down.

active."
[General Communication] Joel Kringle chuckles.
[General Communication] Damien Goss chuckles.

The starship transitions into another sector.
peer out

[Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport]
Welcome to Manhattan Spaceport! The entire place seems brand new, the glass
sparkling, the plasteel gleaming. Starships arrive and depart while others sit
on individual pads, rings of lights blinking around them as they are recharged.
Occasionally, the ground vibrates and the low rumble of heavy hydraulics is
heard as a starship is brought up from the underground garage or lowered for
extended parking below. Around the huge landing pad, wide, arched doorways
framed in brushed steel lead to various station services: Repair & Rearm to the
northeast, Supply to the southeast, Station Security to the southwest, and the
Mail Room to the northwest. In addition, a classy lighted sign over one doorway
reads, 'Pilot Lounge.' You can GO into it. There is also a doorway marked
'Liaison Office' that you can also GO into. Over the corridor to the south,
another sign reads 'Spaceport Exit and Express Train.'
The two-person light transport "Registered Merchant 797" and the five-person
hammerhead "Akrep" are landed here.
You see an asteroid-shaped steel trash bin here.
You can go north, northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, northwest,
and down.
Lily Kaise's voice comes over the loudspeaker and says, "Are we going to short
crew or is this it?"
[Tactical Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "1 person for beacons."
You are credited with 3,099,356.05 League credits of bounty.
154,967.80 credits of your income have gone toward your organization.

charged.

[Starship "Aslan"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is at Old Earth; Manhattan Spaceport.
You see a large leather chair here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.
You can go north and down.

the ship enters normal status.

powered down.

Earthgate Station dominates space here, acting as a watchpost for the approach
to Old Earth.
The computer says, "Jump sequence aborted."
Ali Candan presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
Via general sector communication, Earthgate transmits, "Hello there, Aslan!
Welcome to home space!"
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
>48icY8)BQ$ufDf<80;'5ElfkAa]bN"fm{|"Tp}|
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Ali Candan presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 2226 light-minutes per second from Galactic West and
Slightly Up."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'Aslan.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: League Unmanned Pickup
Debris-Burning Temporary Station.

"Greetings."

signal at this ship: "Greetings."

standard signal at this ship: "Greetings."

hold.

Ali Candan says, OOCly, "Debris."

l refrig
a shiny black refrigerator with chrome accents
This refrigerator is made of metal painted black. It has rounded contours and
chrome accents. The back is a maze of repaired or replaced tubes and cables, and
is apparently held together with steel straps, small welds, and a good amount of
duct tape.
It is open.
Inside it you see a boilermaker, a tall glass of Cicero's own home-brewed
barleywine, a small hot beverage dispenser, a small hot tea dispenser, a fresh
fruit juice dispenser, a glass, a glass, a bulky cylinder with a vaguely
spout-like protrusion on the top, and a small hot coffee dispenser.

credits from a toll payment to League Rift Accelerating Battery-Powered Toll
Station in Waypoint Alpha 135.

launch

2
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
Lbs|gM^1q~4j=kN"e%HW?|SJ!ha5wiHX_//6jB4p
You stumble, then fall heavily to the floor.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
sit couch

sit sofa
You sit up onto a red upholstered sofa.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 2252 light-minutes per second from Galactic West and
Slightly Up."

"Detecting vessel 'Widowmaker.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

l
[Starship "Widowmaker"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a high tech black star print holovid, a red upholstered sofa, and a
shiny black refrigerator with chrome accents here.
You can go up and out.
Would you like to request landing clearance at New Earth?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You notify flight control of your desire to land.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Widowmaker. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
out

coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a clear plastic food storage container, Purr the humanoid
service robot, a compact red refrigerator, a red plastic food storage container,
and a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top here.
You can go south and out.
A long orange soft-bodied creature with many claw-tipped tentacles propels
itself through the tank, stirring up tiny particles.
out
out
[Starship "William Dove"; Airlock]
You see a large secure xenology storage container, a row of flightlockers, a rug
woven of large dark green fern fronds, a glossy seashell pink ceramic felo chow
bowl, a personal hoverpallet, a luxuriously soft oval amethyst rug with a gold
fleur-de-lys in the center and thick gold fringe, and Shasta the big onyx
soldier felo here.
You can go out and enter into the ship.
You exit the ship.

You see a wormhole drive tracer here.

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
launch

sit

launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

ftl new
A small light next to the word AUTOPILOT switches on, while a similar light next
to the word MANUAL switches off.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Courageous!
Welcome to home space!"
green
You lift a small plastic cover and press a green button.
You hear a single beep and glance up to see green lights flick on overhead as
the ship enters normal status.
A low hum you had barely noticed until now slowly fades away as weapons are
powered down.

power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
l
[Starship "Courageous"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a wormhole drive tracer here.
You can go down and out.
(You are sitting.)

A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Courageous, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."

A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
;Y?GZ6F[j6JfFGR5P-_t_$vp!9z^O_5q%07kXH\K
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.

thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large

l
[New Earth; Piper Wincott Memorial Garage]
Even though this starship garage smells like machine oil and heavy lubricants,
it is spacious and well-lit. Massive hydraulic systems raise and lower starships
to and from the landing pad above, and technicians and mechanics in silvery gray
coveralls ensure that everything keeps running smoothly. A well-lit stairway
which leads to the pilot's lounge is here.
You can go up.

l
[Starship "Supernova"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. The status lights overhead are
currently not receiving power. Looking through the windows, you see that the
ship is in a garage.
You see an overstuffed black chair, a transparisteel storage case, and an
improved temporary wormhole drive here.
You can go north and south.
[General Communication] Caleb Davenport transmits, "Not much here."

ftl museum
You stumble, then fall heavily to the floor.
(3 seconds roundtime.)
A lone outpost glitters in an otherwise nondescript cloud of debris.
The League's legendary shipyards hang motionless in the dark here. Once, the
stations would be all but glowing with waste heat as the Intersector
Shipbuilding Company rolled out ship after ship. Now the stations are still and
darkened, and the ISC is no more.

sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.

[Aerial Fortress "Stellar Haven"; Mess Hall]
You see a dark brown rattan dining chair with a high back with a blue cushion on
it, a round white rattan dining table with a glass top, a dark brown rattan
dining chair with a high back with a light blue cushion on it, and a blue rattan
cabinet here.
You can go northeast, east, and south.
l abinet
I see no "abinet" here.
l cabinet
a blue rattan cabinet
This tall cabinet is framed in medium-weight rattan that has been washed in blue
stain and buffed to a soft shine. Matching in color, the sides and doors are
filled with wicker woven into a simple but graceful arcing pattern, and
burnished brass fittings accent the doors.
It is closed.
open cabinet
You open a blue rattan cabinet.
l cabinet
a blue rattan cabinet
This tall cabinet is framed in medium-weight rattan that has been washed in blue
stain and buffed to a soft shine. Matching in color, the sides and doors are
filled with wicker woven into a simple but graceful arcing pattern, and
burnished brass fittings accent the doors.
It is open.
It is empty.
close cabinet
You close a blue rattan cabinet.

l hover
a personal hoverpallet
This is a large hovering surface which can hold furniture and other items which
would otherwise be inconvenient and tiring to transport. A small button with a
built-in thumbprint reader toggles whether it is following.
On top of it you see a red guitar case.
remove guitar
You remove a black guitar case.
put guitar on hover
You put a black guitar case on a personal hoverpallet.

[Space Station "Tandem"; Lower Hub]
Lit by regularly spaced panels recessed into the walls, this area is circular,
with a winding staircase in the center of it leading up to a higher level of the
station, where it is always brighter and noisier than here. The same staircase
has a downward extension, but it is blocked by a metal grate with a sign on it.
To the east and west are long corridors, and to the north is a quiet area, its
arched entrance framed with a slender, smoothly curved water panel, the small
bubbles inside continually generated and rising upward to the apex of the arch.
You can go north, east, west, and up.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 26
Laser Upgrades:
FRONTIER ANTI-HAZARD LASER (Drydock)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 3 Grid Usage: 30 Hull Accuracy Added: 12%
Time To Fire: 3s
CENTAURIAN CIVIL DEFENSE LASER (Bikura)
Requirements: 0 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 5 Grid Usage: 20 Hull Accuracy Added: 10%
Time To Fire: 3s
EAOS WARTIME AUGMENTED DEFENSE LASER (Bikura)
Requirements: 100 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 6 Grid Usage: 18 Hull Accuracy Added: 7%
Time To Fire: 3s
COALITION STANDARD LASER MK IV (Drydock)
Requirements: 200 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 7.35 Grid Usage: 20 Hull Accuracy Added: 8%
Time To Fire: 3s
AEU NAVAL HEAVY LASER (Bikura)
Requirements: 240 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 18 Grid Usage: 32 Hull Accuracy Added: 0%
Time To Fire: 5s
VORTEX INDUSTRIES INTENSITY LASER V2 (New Earth allied and Aenea)
Requirements: 350 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 10 Grid Usage: 25 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
FIENSTEIN EXPERIMENTAL HEAVY LASER (Aenea and New Earth Allied Technologies)
Requirements: 500 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 23 Grid Usage: 42 Hull Accuracy Added: 0%
Time To Fire: 5s
CAPELLA NAVAL OFFENSIVE LASER (Endymion)
Requirements: 700 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 13 Grid Usage: 30 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
EAOS CRYSTALLINE OPTICS LASER MK II (Endymion)
Requirements: 950 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 15 Grid Usage: 35 Hull Accuracy Added: 5%
Time To Fire: 4s
COALITION SUPER-HEAVY LASER MK II (Capella)
Requirements: 980 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 30 Grid Usage: 50 Hull Accuracy Added: 0%
Time To Fire: 5s
Lasers are most often an AEU pilot's favorite weapon. This is mostly due to the
fact that most AEU ships get nice bonuses for our laser turrets, which makes
using them more worthwhile than using something like chainguns. In some
instances, the lasers also get a really good hull bonus which make them more
useful than heavy launchers if you have a strong enough laser upgrade. The
downside to using lasers however, is that they really drain the combat grid. So
you'll want to find a laser turret that has a good balance between damage, hull
bonus and combat energy grid. There is also a time issue, too. Some of the
heavier lasers pack a nice punch, but have a five second firing time. This could
theoretically hamper your ability to destroy ships in a timely manner. Note: the
potential damage points information in the above stats do not reflect the
additional bonus damage points available in some AEU ships.
[Notification from Starseekers] A load of salvage has been received at League
Unmanned Pickup Debris-Burning Temporary Station from the two-person medium
transport "Money Maker". The organization has earned 579,561.38 credits.

An AEU Pilot's Guide To Ships And Upgrades                                      
  Page 29
Minicannon Launcher:
JINU SALVAGE MINIATURIZED PLASMA CANNON (Capella)
Requirements: 850 combat points
Potential Damage Points: 100 Grid Usage: 200 Hull Accuracy Added: 0%
Time To Fire: 4s
Currently there is only one minicannon launcher available. Minicannons are good
in that they require no ammunition, and still pack a heavy punch. However, they
are good at draining your energy grid fairly quickly, especially if you have
more than one launcher in your weapons room.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, a clear plastic food storage container, a red plastic
food storage container, a round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, and
Purr the humanoid service robot here.
You can go south and out.
Lily Kaise just entered the ship.
Lily Kaise grasps a large lever on the control board and pushes it slowly away
from her.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
Lily Kaise wraps her arms around you, pulling you close.
Lily Kaise uses the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
wrap lily
You wrap your arms around Lily Kaise, pulling her close.
Lily Kaise sits down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made
white and sapphire star quilt on it.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "William Dove, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
sit couch
You sit down on a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it.
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, William
Dove! Welcome to home space!"
Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the starship's navigation controls.
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
[General Communication] Ali Candan transmits, "Goodness. With that storm and the
flow, you can get to the Bubble in 10 minutes or so. I've never seen it that
fast."
You notice Lily Kaise using the radio to ask for landing clearance.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "I'll offer them pie."
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, William Dove. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
Lily Kaise grins.
grin
You grin.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "As in pizza pie."
Lily Kaise pulls a large lever towards her.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
The computer sounds a notification indicating that the ship has been fully
charged.
Lily Kaise stands up from a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made
white and sapphire star quilt on it.
Lily Kaise joins your group.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.

mystic purple cats.

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Sean Sloan, Johann Rowan, Lily Kaise, and Damien Alexander are standing here.
You can go out.
(You are sitting on a slim and fashionable couch.)

A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

l
[Starship "Emerald McKay"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a large leather couch, a decoy beacon
launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a compact red refrigerator here.
Sean Sloan is lying down. Johann Rowan, Damien Alexander, Ali Candan, and Lily
Kaise are standing here.
You can go south and out.
pull sean
You pull Sean Sloan to his feet.
l
[Starship "Emerald McKay"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a large leather couch, a decoy beacon
launcher, a wormhole drive tracer, and a compact red refrigerator here.
Sean Sloan, Johann Rowan, Damien Alexander, Ali Candan, and Lily Kaise are
standing here.
You can go south and out.

y
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "What's up all?"
(4 seconds roundtime.)
A high warbling alarm suddenly goes off. Speaking over it, the computer
announces, "Fatal hit received. Occupants must stand by for emergency ejection."
You suddenly float up into the air as the ship's artificial gravity abruptly
switches off, and you feel your hair stand on end as the ship projects an
electromagnetic field around you. Suddenly, every seam of the ship seems to come
apart, exposing you to space. You quickly close your eyes as the vacuum pulls at
your skin and the electromagnetic field tugs you rapidly toward a starship
rescue pod.
[Emerald McKay Rescue Pod]
Ali Candan, Lily Kaise, Johann Rowan, and Damien Alexander are standing here.
You can go nowhere.
The pod simply drifts for a moment as its automatic navigation systems come
online. Then it smoothly maneuvers through the wreckage of the starship and out
into open space.
A metallic silver metachannel FTL communicator chirps quietly as it receives a
new notice.
[General Communication] Demarco Scott transmits, "Hi hi evenia!"
[General Communication] Joel Kringle transmits, "Smash and grab."
Lily Kaise sighs.
Damien Alexander says in a Tenosque accent, "Oof."
Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.
New Earth rotates through space before you, a startingly verdant planet, colored
in greens and blues with pure white clouds.
Via general sector communication, New Earth transmits, "Hello there, Emerald
McKay Rescue Pod! Welcome to home space!"
The ship rapidly heads toward a planet.
Lily Kaise hugs you.
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Hi hi Demarco!"
Sean Sloan says in an Old Earth accent, "When did they change the tracking."
Rescue workers quickly empty the landed rescue pod.

The Emerald McKay rescue pod is landed here.
You see an automatic teller machine and a small trash can here.
Ali Candan, Lily Kaise, Johann Rowan, and Damien Alexander are standing here.
You can go north, south, west, and down.
Spaceport workers efficiently haul the spent pod out of the way.
[General Communication] Evenia Callseah transmits, "Sounds like a blast Joel."

[New Earth; Medical Center]
The medical center is a sterile white, punctuated by wood paneling, pastel
paintings, and aquariums, all meant to soothe and reassure. The effect is
undermined as your nose burns with the distinctive smell of a hospital. Through
a curtained area of the medical center, you glimpse row after row of the healing
machines known as medical creches, looking unpleasantly like coffins.
Ali Candan is lying on a medical creche. Lily Kaise, Damien Alexander, and
Johann Rowan are standing here.

Once the frontier of Known Space for many years, the Borderlands region is now a
settled area of space, though rather poor compared to most others. A handful of
beacons indicate the positions of clouds of debris, but a nearby star indicates
a solar system may also be in this cluster.

and debris has been pulled in its wake, leaving a funnel-shaped void.

backpack. You are concealing a golden Feng Wo coin purse, a black flightbag with
a red shooting star on the side, a camera bag, an asteroid hauling supply kit, a
flight control scanner, a large expandable telescoping xenology container, a
black engineering tool case, a scorched metal thigh holster, and a leather
briefcase. Your head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.

l
[Starship "Critical Strike"; Engineering Room]
The engineering room is much cleaner and sterile than most people expect when
they first board a starship. Though there are some exposed, thick bundles of
wires running here and there, most of the actual workings of the ship are deeper
in its structure. Instead, the room is virtually bare and brightly lit, with one
wall dominated by a large graphical representation of the ship and its
components, alongside current estimates of damage levels. On the right is a
small starmap set into a wall, displaying a bare minimum of information so that
it is not a distraction to the one keeping the ship together. A simple control
board allows the operator to prioritize repairs. Lights overhead indicate that
the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows, you see that the ship
is at Providence Station; Docking Bay.
You see an overstuffed red chair, an improved temporary wormhole drive, and an
improved temporary wormhole drive here.
Lily Kaise and Ali Candan are standing here.
You can go north and south.

Lily Kaise: League Paladin (Tier 5)
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

l
[Starship "Critical Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a black leather captain's chair, a wormhole
drive tracer, a black leather sofa, and a steel plaque engraved with the phrase
"Reminder: This ship is equipped with a sensor dampening array." here.
Ali Candan, Johann Rowan, Damien Alexander, and Lily Kaise are standing here.
You can go south and out.
Would you like to request docking clearance for AFW Command (Dock One)?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
You notify flight control of your desire to dock.
A voice says over the speaker, "Roger, cleared to land at this Accord of Free
Worlds port."
Damien Alexander rubs his eyes.
stand
You're already standing.

New Earth; Spaceport Mail Room.
You are credited with 3,692,863.98 AEU credits of bounty.
184,643.20 credits of your income have gone toward your organization.

[Accord of Free Worlds Command; Docking Bay One]
The one-person marauder "Burn, Don't Freeze", the one-person fighter "Gambit",
the one-person cargo hauler "Current Mood", the one-person supply shuttle
"Shangri-la Terraform Group 179", the four-person Accord space module transport
"Building Blocks For Adults Are Way Underrated", the two-person Accord space
module scout "Up Up And Away!", the two-person tugboat "Stick And Go", the
four-person Accord space module transport "Shadowed Sunset", the three-person
stalwart "Red In Tooth And Claw", and the five-person pulsar "Critical Strike"
are landed here.

[Starship "Critical Strike"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad.
You see a decoy beacon launcher, a black leather captain's chair, a wormhole
drive tracer, a black leather sofa, and a steel plaque engraved with the phrase
"Reminder: This ship is equipped with a sensor dampening array." here.
Ali Candan and Lily Kaise are standing here.
You can go south and out.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
The eight-person soothsayer Mark Two "Creature Of The Night", the five-person
pulsar "Dies Iri", and the two-person Accord gemini "Tahtien Enkeli" are landed
here.

The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
She seems to have a bruise on her forehead. 
 She is wearing a puff-sleeved strawberry red silk blouse with a sweetheart
neckline, a pair of blue stonewashed denim jeans with a small dark red 'XX'
embroidered on the left front pocket, and a pair of baby blue leather clogs with
a row of multicolored daisies across the toes. She is also wearing an orange and
white blessed prayer bracelet around her wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny
tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon purple wrist-mounted chronometer,
a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies, a delicate ring of silver wire
and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic gold touch einrophone in a
metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard
snuggly labeled 'Asteria', and a Tardick lizard named Asteria perched on her
shoulder. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both elbows, both forearms, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.
Lily Kaise says in a New Earth accent, "Oh I'm going to go put the lizie down. I
bet she might be needing a nap."
Lily Kaise stands up from a large leather couch.
Lily Kaise glides north.

[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.
The five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William Dove" is landed here.

support
The "support" command is used for all in-game issues of any type, including
bugs, typos, discussions about ongoing roleplaying, and requests for urgent
assistance.
Do you wish to submit a support request to the staff?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y
Please enter a brief subject for your support request, summarizing your issue or
question in a few words.
[Type a line of input or `@abort' to abort the command.]
Confirmation bypass when gunning
VERY IMPORTANT: Please enter any further details that might help the staff
address your issue. In the case of a bug, please try to include all information
necessary for the staff to research your issue: Exactly what did you do to
encounter the bug? What was the exact result? What was the exact text you
encountered? What result, exactly, were you expecting instead? Exactly what
steps could be taken to encounter the same issue again? If you have an issue
with a specific item, please include where we can find it. If you have an issue
with a ship, please include its exact name so we can find it. The less detail
we're given, the less likely it is we'll be able to fix the issue.
[Type lines of input; use `.' to end or `@abort' to abort the command.]
Hello, During the first of the missions we ran this morning, one of the gunners
had the object to bypass the confirmations when guning. When it seemed that the
mission was going to be a bit much and was harder than usualy, we asked him to
put it away. He said that it had already been put away, but we didn't see any
changes and it resulted in my ship exploding. Is this to be expected? It seems a
bit much that one person was able to affect a mission so jurastically. Thanks.
*
.
Do you want to review your support ticket before you send it?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
y

full time staff coverage, but we will try to address your issue with minimal
turnaround time. You may use the SUPPORT command again to track responses to
your request.
