1
--
Subject:                 Confirmation bypass when gunning
By:                      Shule Elemmire
Location:                Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One
Originally submitted:    Mon Jul 25 05:26:34 2016 UTC
Last followup:           Mon Jul 25 07:27:22 2016 UTC
Staff response expected: No
--
Message 1:
From the player...
Hello, During the first of the missions we ran this morning, one of the gunners
had the object to bypass the confirmations when guning. When it seemed that the
mission was going to be a bit much and was harder than usualy, we asked him to
put it away. He said that it had already been put away, but we didn't see any
changes and it resulted in my ship exploding. Is this to be expected? It seems a
bit much that one person was able to affect a mission so jurastically. Thanks.
--
Message 2:
From the staff, submitted on Mon Jul 25 2016 UTC...
How on earth does a lack of gunning confirmations lead to a ship exploding?

This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor;
Docking Bay.

rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a

support
Recent Support Tickets
--
[1] Confirmation bypass when gunning (Staff Response)
--
[2] New Support Request
Enter your selection:
1
--
Subject:                 Confirmation bypass when gunning
By:                      Shule Elemmire
Location:                Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One
Originally submitted:    Mon Jul 25 05:26:34 2016 UTC
Last followup:           Mon Jul 25 07:36:39 2016 UTC
Staff response expected: No
--
Message 1:
From the player...
Hello, During the first of the missions we ran this morning, one of the gunners
had the object to bypass the confirmations when guning. When it seemed that the
mission was going to be a bit much and was harder than usualy, we asked him to
put it away. He said that it had already been put away, but we didn't see any
changes and it resulted in my ship exploding. Is this to be expected? It seems a
bit much that one person was able to affect a mission so jurastically. Thanks.
--
Message 2:
From the staff, submitted on Mon Jul 25 2016 UTC...
How on earth does a lack of gunning confirmations lead to a ship exploding?
--
Message 3:
From the staff, submitted on Mon Jul 25 2016 UTC...
After several minutes of meditation and contemplating my life, I think I
understand what you were implying, so let me offer this as a reply instead:
The presence of a weapons bypass key has absolutely zero effect on mission
response or difficulty.
--
Do you wish to send a followup message under this ticket?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
[AEU | 10: Conquest Status] An AEU pilot corps liaison transmits, "We've met our
first tier performance goal! Let's keep pushing for the second!"
n
Goodbye!

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
She seems to have a bruise on her forehead. 
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon purple
flowers, a pair of tight white denim jeans with a small dark-red 'XX'
embroidered on the back left pocket, and a pair of sparkly white leather clogs.
She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her
wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon
purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies,
a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and
a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both
eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
She seems to have a bruise on her forehead. 
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon purple
flowers, a pair of tight white denim jeans with a small dark-red 'XX'
embroidered on the back left pocket, and a pair of sparkly white leather clogs.
She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her
wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon
purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies,
a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, a
soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria', and a Tardick lizard
named Asteria perched on her shoulder. Her head, face, both eyes, neck, both
wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying a cup of hot French vanilla coffee in her left hand.

Starseekers
--
General Information
  Purpose:            When the hard work of the day is done, and you are looking
for a place to meet friends. When things become boring and you can't wait to see
something new. Then there is Starseekers, a cool, relaxing place to hang out,
meet old and new friends, and experience something new. Every pilot who believes
there's more to life than points and credits will be welcome here!
  Slogan:             "There's always something new beyond the next star."
  Founder:             Kim Saunders
  Trustees:            Angel Martin and Shule Elemmire
  Members:             11
  Total Members:       14
  Total Active:        9
  Founded on:          22 May 2312
  Public:              Yes
  Recruiting:          No
Unity
  Member Alliances:    AEU, Fringe, and League
  Unity:               79%
Assets
  Credits on Hand:     56,762,092,237.13 EAOS credits
  Starship Insurance:  1,266,580,101.70 EAOS credits
  Support Fund:        5,231,111,110.00 EAOS credits
  Starships Owned:     21
  Starships Supported: 3 of 15
  Support Cost:        240,000,000.00 EAOS credits
  Megacredits:         834
  Member Megacredits:  300
Progress

  Space Combat:        3562
  Ground Combat:       1745

credits / 2 megacredits
    This module enables the manual ejection of the mobile storage module, so
that it can be taken to a spaceport and transferred while the station is still
online.
    Command: 500
    Power Used: 10
[2] Storage Container Daily Pickup                          20,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 3 megacredits
    This module enables automatic daily ejection of the mobile storage module,
as well as automatic transfer prior to its demise.
    Command: 1000
    Power Used: 15
[3] Storage Container Unmanned Pickup                       5,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 1 megacredits
    This module enables a storage module to be ejected while the station is
still online. The module will then be picked up by an unmanned transport and
returned to a spaceport. Requires a station in communications range.
    Industry: 1000
    Power Used: 10

credits / 5 megacredits
    This module enables the instant transfer of the station's mobile storage
module to a spaceport capable of processing its contents.
    Command: 2000
    Power Used: 20

Providence Station shines brightly in the dark, one of the few stations that
bothers to illuminate its outer hull. The gleaming hull of the station is bathed
with bright white floodlights.

Enter your destination:
[Type a line of input or `@abort' to abort the command.]
1
A destination appears on the ship's navigation controls: New Earth.
Would you like to request landing clearance at New Earth?
[Enter `yes' or `no']
The computer reports that the five-person A.S.S. tactical platform "William
Dove" has launched from New Earth.
y
You notify flight control of your desire to land.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Hello, Shooting Star. We read your AEU
transponder. You are cleared to land at the city of New Phoenix."
The computer informs you that you have mail waiting, which may be picked up at
New Earth; Spaceport Mail Room.
power
You pull a large lever towards you.
The faint sounds and status lights of the starship's systems slowly fade away,
leaving you in a dim silence.
out
You exit the capsule.

Abilities for League Knight
Light
   [1]  Flare                                             300,000.00
        Attracts attention from a group of enemies.
   [2]  Flash                                             950,000.00
        Startles an enemy with a bright flash of light, often causing them to
stop what they were doing.
   [3]  Illuminate                                        1,300,000.00
        Allows your squad to hit more vital parts of the enemy, increasing
damage.
   [4]  Radiate                                           2,300,000.00
        Radiates light over your battlesuit, causing the enemy to misdirect some
damage, effectively increasing armor.
   [5]  Laser Guidance                                    3,300,000.00
        Augments your squad's accuracy.
   [6]  Blind                                             4,300,000.00
        Blinds a single target for a period of time.
   [7]  Directed Flare                                    5,300,000.00
        Irritates and provokes a single target.

sw
[New Earth Spaceport; Aerial Fortresses]
You can go northeast, east, southeast, south, southwest, west, and northwest.
s
[New Earth Spaceport; Low Priority Ground Deployment]
You can go north.
deploy
You press a prominent button, and a crane promptly retrieves a League Knight
from spaceport storage and sets it in front of you.
enter
You press a button on a League Knight, which splits open down the front. You
carefully climb inside.
commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
ca.....................................................Cylinder Accelerator
f......................................................Powered Shotgun
y......................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dis....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
eb.....................................................Energy Bottle      
(energy bottle)
det....................................................Detonator          
(detonator)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

l
[Starship "Fearless"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a black leather captain's chair, a discount beacon launcher, and a
moderate minimodule of energy capacity and energy generation here.
You can go up and out.

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[RATS Nest; Drop Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This is just inside a location where the nest is open to space. Before you
extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.

crafted from metal.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see Sentry Horde Replicator and Enhanced Warrior Alpha here.
You can go east and west.

grately appreciated."

l damie
Damien Alexander (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour)
This is a slim but fairly tough-looking battlesuit, painted white all over,
except where the paint has worn off. It resembles some sort of large humanoid
robot. A slim cockpit encases the pilot's torso, while the pilot's arms and legs
extend into a framework of hydraulics and cables with some protective plating. A
large subsonic projector is mounted to the left shoulder. A repeating weapon
attachment is mounted to the right wrist. A microdrone applicator is attached to
the left wrist, a hose leading to a large tank on the left bicep.
It appears to be 0% damaged.
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "Looks like we're all here."
Ali Candan nods.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.
You see Miniaturized Interfacing Companion Entity Alpha and Miniaturized
Interfacing Companion Entity Beta here.
You can go northeast and southwest.

This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

l
[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

l
[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You see the wreckage of Sentry Horde Replicator and Enhanced Warrior Alpha,
Damien Alexander (AISSF Rental Advanced Combat Armour), Ali Candan (Fringe
Man-At-Arms), Cesar Ysidro (AEU Utility Combatant), Ted Warburton (AISSF Rental
Advanced Combat Armour), a one-use repair drone, an energy bottle, and a portion
of a RATS deep space battery here.
You can go southeast and northwest.
Ted Warburton picks up a portion of a RATS deep space battery.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

Interfacing Companion Entity Beta here.

[Starship "RockIt!"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is at Comet Surface.
You see a small lavender trash bin, a glossy violet ceramic felo chow bowl,
Daizey the humanoid service robot, a large purple and lavender paisley floor
pillow with thick gold fringe, a sleeping big blue cyclops felo, a large white
and dusky pink paisley floor pillow with thick silver fringe, an old big blue
sabre-toothed felo, a big blue cyclops felo, and a hefty blue soldier felo here.
Lily Kaise is standing here.

an old big blue sabre-toothed felo
This strange, six-legged creature is vaguely cat-like, though its head appears
almost vulpine. It is large in size and covered in short, striped blue fur,
possessing a short, thin tail that slowly flicks back and forth. The felo's
long, thin legs each end in three-toed paws with thick, hooked black claws
visible. A white, square nose sits below a pair of clear indigo eyes with
horizontal pupils. A pair of vicious sabre-tooth fangs protrude from its mouth.

[1] Small Precharged Battery                                5,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 1 megacredits
    This small battery array will not provide much power or keep your station
online for very long, but it is the best option for getting a station online on
the cheap.
    Power Supplied: 50
[2] Medium Precharged Battery                               15,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 3 megacredits
    This medium-sized battery array provides below-average power levels, but it
does keep your station online for several days.
    Industry: 500
    Power Supplied: 75
[3] Standard Fusion Containment                             20,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 4 megacredits
    This is the standard power source for small space stations. Its power level
is adequate for many needs and the station will remain online for several days.
    Industry: 1000
    Power Supplied: 100
[4] Large Precharged Battery                                40,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 8 megacredits
    This large battery array manages to match the output of the fusion power
plant and lasts a bit longer.
    Industry: 1500
    Power Supplied: 100
[5] Solar Panel Array                                       30,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 6 megacredits
    Solar power is a reliable and efficient way to power a space station. This
proven system's minimal strain will keep a station online for over a week. Of
course, it is only useful in the vicinity of a star.
    Industry: 2000  Exploration: 500
    Power Supplied: Variable -- 100 at Sol-equivalent luminosity
[6] Small Blast Chamber                                     30,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 6 megacredits
    This is a debris-burning fusion blast chamber. It can provide a good amount
of power for a significant length of time. However, it must be kept supplied
with raw material. This model is much more energy efficient than its larger
cousin, but it also has a smaller furnace capacity due to its size.
    Industry: 2500  Exploration: 650
    Power Supplied: 125
[7] Fission Breeder Reactor                                 50,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 10 megacredits
    This is a modular fission power plant. It will give a space station a great
deal of power, though not the longest lifetime.
    Industry: 3000  Exploration: 500
    Power Supplied: 150
[8] Blast Chamber                                           50,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 10 megacredits
    This is a debris-burning fusion blast chamber. It can provide a great deal
of power for a significant length of time. However, it must be kept supplied
with raw material.
    Industry: 4000  Exploration: 750
    Power Supplied: 175
[9] Slow-burning Fusion Containment                         120,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 24 megacredits
    This is an extremely long-lasting power source suitable for small stations.
    Industry: 7500
    Power Supplied: 30

[1] Small Precharged Battery                                5,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 1 megacredits
    This small battery array will not provide much power or keep your station
online for very long, but it is the best option for getting a station online on
the cheap.
    Power Supplied: 50
[2] Medium Precharged Battery                               15,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 3 megacredits
    This medium-sized battery array provides below-average power levels, but it
does keep your station online for several days.
    Industry: 500
    Power Supplied: 75
[3] Standard Fusion Containment                             20,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 4 megacredits
    This is the standard power source for small space stations. Its power level
is adequate for many needs and the station will remain online for several days.
    Industry: 1000
    Power Supplied: 100
[4] Large Precharged Battery                                40,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 8 megacredits
    This large battery array manages to match the output of the fusion power
plant and lasts a bit longer.
    Industry: 1500
    Power Supplied: 100
[5] Solar Panel Array                                       30,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 6 megacredits
    Solar power is a reliable and efficient way to power a space station. This
proven system's minimal strain will keep a station online for over a week. Of
course, it is only useful in the vicinity of a star.
    Industry: 2000  Exploration: 500
    Power Supplied: Variable -- 100 at Sol-equivalent luminosity
[6] Small Blast Chamber                                     30,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 6 megacredits
    This is a debris-burning fusion blast chamber. It can provide a good amount
of power for a significant length of time. However, it must be kept supplied
with raw material. This model is much more energy efficient than its larger
cousin, but it also has a smaller furnace capacity due to its size.
    Industry: 2500  Exploration: 650
    Power Supplied: 125
[7] Fission Breeder Reactor                                 50,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 10 megacredits
    This is a modular fission power plant. It will give a space station a great
deal of power, though not the longest lifetime.
    Industry: 3000  Exploration: 500
    Power Supplied: 150
[8] Blast Chamber                                           50,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 10 megacredits
    This is a debris-burning fusion blast chamber. It can provide a great deal
of power for a significant length of time. However, it must be kept supplied
with raw material.
    Industry: 4000  Exploration: 750
    Power Supplied: 175
[9] Slow-burning Fusion Containment                         120,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 24 megacredits
    This is an extremely long-lasting power source suitable for small stations.
    Industry: 7500
    Power Supplied: 30

[1] Storage Container Manual Ejection                       15,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 2 megacredits
    This module enables the manual ejection of the mobile storage module, so

online.

[2] Storage Container Daily Pickup                          20,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 3 megacredits
    This module enables automatic daily ejection of the mobile storage module,
as well as automatic transfer prior to its demise.
    Command: 1000
    Power Used: 15
[3] Storage Container Unmanned Pickup                       5,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 1 megacredits
    This module enables a storage module to be ejected while the station is
still online. The module will then be picked up by an unmanned transport and
returned to a spaceport. Requires a station in communications range.
    Industry: 1000
    Power Used: 10

credits / 5 megacredits
    This module enables the instant transfer of the station's mobile storage
module to a spaceport capable of processing its contents.
    Command: 2000
    Power Used: 20

[1] Minimum Capacity Salvage Op Controller                  30,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 6 megacredits
    This is a salvage op controller, the core module which enables salvage ops
to occur. It has the ability to conduct six salvage ops.
    Industry: 1000  Space Combat: 500
    Power Used: 40

credits / 10 megacredits

to occur. It has the ability to conduct ten salvage ops.
    Industry: 2000  Space Combat: 1000  Command: 100
    Power Used: 60

credits / 16 megacredits
    This is a salvage op controller, the core module which enables salvage ops
to occur. It has the ability to conduct fifteen salvage ops.
    Industry: 3000  Space Combat: 2000  Command: 500
    Power Used: 80

8
[1] Storage Container Manual Ejection                       15,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 2 megacredits
    This module enables the manual ejection of the mobile storage module, so
that it can be taken to a spaceport and transferred while the station is still
online.
    Command: 500
    Power Used: 10
[2] Storage Container Daily Pickup                          20,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 3 megacredits
    This module enables automatic daily ejection of the mobile storage module,
as well as automatic transfer prior to its demise.
    Command: 1000
    Power Used: 15
[3] Storage Container Unmanned Pickup                       5,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 1 megacredits
    This module enables a storage module to be ejected while the station is
still online. The module will then be picked up by an unmanned transport and
returned to a spaceport. Requires a station in communications range.
    Industry: 1000
    Power Used: 10
[4] Storage Container Wormhole Transfer                     30,000,000.00 EAOS
credits / 5 megacredits
    This module enables the instant transfer of the station's mobile storage
module to a spaceport capable of processing its contents.
    Command: 2000
    Power Used: 20

Lily Kaise presses a button and brings up the FTL flight control board.
A pair of odd-colored stars, one green and one blue, mark this curious area of
space. The sensors are picking up odd bits of noise that the ship's computer
insists on trying to convert to audio. Once in a while, something that could
almost sound like a word emerges from a burst of static.
The computer reports that in-sector beacons are transmitting the following:
#KrtZ~+Anu!'s,*wLM6=`t|rZaVK>&I9$'xNO0"*
This area of space is within the green belt of the nearest star, but there are
no life-bearing planets here. Instead there is merely an odd cluster of space
stations of unknown origin.
The sensor noise is much worse here, with a constant dark, gutteral snarling
sound emanating from the ship's speakers. It almost sounds like a language, but
it's nothing you've ever heard before, and the ship's computer cannot pinpoint a
source.
Via general sector communication, a temporary space station transmits, "Current
riftflow conditions are 2936 light-minutes per second from Galactic
Eastsoutheast and Slightly Down."
Via general sector communication, Beacon E-02 transmits in a robotic voice,
"Detecting vessel 'RockIt!.' Welcome to The Belt of Orion."

The computer announces, "Setting course to Asteroid Beacon Nu 465. Local rift
accelerator with matching vector found."
Something deep inside the starship roars to life as the lights dim sharply.
A wormhole suddenly appears in front of the ship, its edges tinged an unusual
deep purple. Strange undulating shapes are half-visible deep inside it.
A thick undulating mist suddenly seems to rush toward the starship from every
direction, quickly blotting out the stars. Random shapes, some half-familiar,
occasionally form in the mist only to disappear almost immediately.
Bursts of multicolored light suddenly blind you as they slice across your view,
forming winding pathways through billowing clouds.

A formless mist suddenly swirls outside the viewports, then is rapidly sucked
forward into a bright wormhole in front of the ship. The wormhole blinks out of
existence, and the ship is suddenly in normal space.

16
--
Star Conquest Help: Organizations
--
Category: Game Systems
--
An organization allows a group of pilots to organize in a semi-official manner.
Pilots in an organization can:
 * Share funds for the purposes of buying organization-owned starships.
 * Contribute to a group insurance fund to cover the destruction of
organization-owned starships.
 * Have their own communicator channel.
 * Cooperatively operate temporary space stations.
 * Support large starships.
TYPES OF MEMBERS
 * Founder: There is only one founder. This is the person who created the
organization. One must have 1000 aggregate points in order to found an
organization.
 * Acting Founder: If the organization's founder plans on taking a leave of
absence, they can appoint somebody to temporarily stand in as founder of the
organization. Alternately, if the founder (or current acting founder, for that
matter) is inactive for an extended period, a trustee may request the
appointment of a new acting founder. Until the acting founder steps down or the
founder unilaterally revokes their access, they will be treated as the founder
in every way, and the actual founder's vote will be similar to a trustee's.
 * Trustees: These are people with a higher level of trust, with the ability to
propose and vote on organization actions, and buy starships and station modules
on behalf of the organization.
 * Members: Regular members can contribute to the organization and use
organization-owned ships.
REQUIREMENTS
The organization, just like an individual pilot, will gradually build up
industry, combat, and other types of points as its members work. In order to buy
a ship or a station module, not only must the trustee meet its requirements, but
the organization must as well.
Members can decide which percentage of their points they are contributing, from
0% to a maximum determined by the size of the organization, most often 10-20%.
UNITY
Organizations are free to take in any member they like belonging to any
alliance. However, once more than one alliance is involved in an organization,
unity is taken into account.
Unity affects both the rate at which an organization earns points, and the total
amount of points it has. Organizations with low unity (for instance, when its
members are at war) are very ineffective.
The more alliances you bring into your organization, the more unity will affect
it. Extremely large organizations will also suffer from disorganization, which
increases unity penalties. The most effective organization will be one
consisting of a few like-minded characters who have banded together for good,
well-roleplayed reasons.
MANAGING AN ORGANIZATION
Organization rooms are present in every capital spaceport. You can manage your
organization with the MENU command, or view its information with the INFO
command.
JOINING AN ORGANIZATION
Organizations may choose to list themselves publicly and offer open recruitment.
You may go to your capital's organization room and apply to any organization
that has done this.
Organizations are also encouraged to use the in-game message board and other IC
means to recruit new members. Recruitment and other organization business should
NEVER occur outside of the game.
ACTIONS
Trustees can initiate and vote on certain actions that affect the organization
as a whole. The action will pass as soon as the "for" votes create a majority,
or fail as soon as an "against" vote makes a majority impossible.
The founder, however, can act as a dictator. Actions initiated by the founder
will be immediately approved. Additionally, the founder's vote will instantly
pass or veto a pending action.
ORGANIZATION POINTS
Organizations gain points much as pilots do. They do this when members that have
chosen to contribute points perform point-gaining activities.
To contribute points to your organization, visit your capital's organization
room and choose the Change Point Contribution Level option. Depending on the
size of your organization, you may set your contribution level to 5%, 10%, 20%,
or even up to 100%. This is the percentage of points that you will "lose" to
your organization. In other words, if your contribution level is 20% and you
gain 10 points from a load of salvage, you will keep 8 points while 2 points go
to your organization.
When an organization has 1000 industry points and 500 space combat points, it
can begin earning command points by contributing certain modules (salvage
processors, salvage op controllers, battle analysis scanners, and certain
others) to temporary space stations. Command points open up unique opportunities
for an organization to assist its alliance, generally with better station
modules.
ORGANIZATION FACILITIES
Each capital spaceport contains a pilot liaison office, and within this office
is an entire level devoted to organizations. This level has its own organization
management center as well as more specific facilities for both business and
pleasure. Organizations can choose to purchase access to these facilities.
STARSHIP SUPPORT
As you may be aware, an alliance sometimes limits the total number of starships
of certain models, particularly gunship- and cruiser-class ships. This is
because an alliance's funding is limited, and starships incur a constant cost in
energy, replacement parts, and routine maintenance performed by spaceport
technicians. Thus, for example, you may wish to buy a cruiser, but find that
your alliance is unwilling to construct and support any more.
However, this can be solved if your organization chooses to take up these costs
instead. Organizations can take over the costs of supporting starships, and
thereby, they can allow starships to be operated beyond the alliance's limit.
Every Conquest period, each starship's support cost will be deducted from the
organization's support fund. If the organization cannot cover its support costs,
flight control will deny launch clearance for the affected ships.
Note that, as of this writing, it is not of any benefit to support ships which
are produced in unlimited numbers. Also, it's important to note that this
affects only the maximum number of available starships, not the rate at which
they are constructed.
VASSALIZATION
Organizations with at least 2000 command points can become "thanes" of less
advanced organizations. "Thane" is an archaic word for one who is able to levy
resources from his or her vassals, but is otherwise not much elevated above
them. Vassalization should not be considered a punitive relationship or a
leadership hierarchy, but rather simply a way to more efficiently distribute
resources.
An organization can offer vassalization to a more advanced organization of the
same alliance, offering to pay 25%, 50%, or 75% of all station part costs in the
form of megacredits. In return, the vassal organization will be counted as a
full contributor on all stations that the thane organization is involved in.
This allows, for example, for a new or less advanced organization to pay for
half of the cost of an expensive salvage op controller module that it cannot buy
on its own, and then be counted as a full and equal contributor towards the
finished station.
In order for a vassal to pay anything, its percentage must work out to be a
whole number. For instance, 25% of a 1-megacredit station core is not a whole
number, and the vassal would not be able to pay anything.
Vassals gain by receiving credit for station activities, and thanes gain by
reducing their own, often much greater costs. This also allows for more
organizations to be involved in a single station. It will also allow
organizations of the same alliance to essentially ally with each other and work
together more closely.
Vassals must designate a certain number of megacredits to be usable by their
thane. Their thane cannot spend more than this amount. Vassals also have full
control over the relationship with the option to unilaterally withdraw
vassalization at any time.
Thanes have a togglable option to use vassal megacredits at all. If a thane
organization wishes to be the sole contributor to a station, it can toggle the
option off. While the option is on, all vassals will contribute their portion of
the station part cost. In the event that there are enough vassals contributing
enough to completely pay for the part, the thane organization will pay nothing.
If there are enough vassals to exceed the part's total cost, the highest
contributing vassals will be prioritized. Thanes can unilaterally remove vassals
at any time.
It is up to the organizations and their members to decide under which
circumstances they might offer, accept, and withdraw vassalization. Again, on
the face of it, the relationship is nothing more than a system of resource
distribution that acknowledges the thane organization's greater access to
advanced station parts and the past effort that was required to gain it.
ORGANIZATION REGULATIONS
Organizations may make whichever rules or regulations they like in regards to
who they accept as members, required contribution levels, whose starships they
will support, and so on. The game's staff will generally not help you enforce
these individual regulations; however, the organization may enforce them itself
in any manner which does not run afoul of the game's policies.
Strange, extreme, or unusual organization rules or actions may have in-character
consequences, as with anything else in the game.
ORGANIZATIONS AND ROLEPLAYING
Organizations are a good way to bring varied groups of people together and have
them engage in either conflict or friendship beyond the usual alliance lines.
Organizations should be a way to meet new people and experience the world with
friends and like-minded characters. Organization-wide endeavors make excellent
fodder for unique events organized by the game's staff.
An organization should strive to avoid becoming insular and isolated from the
rest of the game, and they should not be used as a shortcut to bring out-of-game
relationships into the roleplaying environment. An organization provides you
with another identity for your character and another way in which you can affect
the game world; it should not become a bubble which insulates you from everyone
else's roleplaying.
Additionally, a player should never be cajoled to join or abandon an
organization via out-of-game communications, nor should organization actions be
planned outside of the game. That sort of thing always does massive damage to
the game's roleplaying environment, and it will not be tolerated.
POLICY STATEMENT
Organizations make it easier to get around alliance and point requirements for
starships in a way that is difficult to enforce automatically. That much is
obvious. So in place of that, we'll explicitly state our intentions for how the
system is meant to be used. Working against these intentions in order to avoid
alliance/point requirements WILL be a violation of the Workarounds policy
(Policy 6).
 * Organizations are intended to consist of people who are friends or who at
least wish to actively cooperate. Organizations should not exist purely as
business transactions or as some sort of starship exchange. Additionally, nobody
should ever be paid to found, join, or leave an organization.
 * Members of an organization are expected to remain members on a semi-permanent
basis. Members should not be joining and leaving an organization very quickly,
and especially not joining multiple organizations within a short period of time.
 * Trustees are expected to remain trustees on a semi-permanent basis. Trustees
WILL NOT be promoted just long enough to buy a ship, and then demoted. Other
players WILL NOT be paid or otherwise cajoled to join an organization and become
a trustee just long enough to buy a new ship for it.
 * Again, organizations should never plan or recruit outside of the game. This
is covered in greater detail under Policy 9: Metagaming.
--
Matching Line: VASSALIZATION

[Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay]
The hydraulics for the airlocks lining the long side of this spacious docking
bay run quietly and efficiently, transporting each newly docked ship to an
individual berth outlined with square white lights above and below. The nearly
seamless walls and floor are constructed of light gray metal with signs and
hatchways accented in dark green. Though few people are about, it seems a very
well built and maintained station.

A handful of lonely beacons watch over this area of space, their lights glowing
palely in the dark, surrounded by tendrils of drifting dust and debris.
An obese blue soldier felo stares curiously up at Lily Kaise.
A planet once existed here, until it was destroyed by the Outsiders. Now only
large chunks of the planet remain, still drifting slowly away from each other,
with clouds of debris filling the sector.
A circular space station dominates this sector, made of darkened metal
reinforced against attack. By the look of it, this is probably the most heavily
armored station in human space, excepting The Torus. This is the heart of the
Accord of Free Worlds.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon purple
flowers, a pair of tight white denim jeans with a small dark-red 'XX'
embroidered on the back left pocket, and a pair of sparkly white leather clogs.
She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her
wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon
purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies,
a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and
a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both
eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying a length of air hose in her right hand.

do you think?"

a storage container unmanned pickup module (contributed by Morning Star)
This is a side module.
This module enables a storage module to be ejected while the station is still
online. The module will then be picked up by an unmanned transport and returned
to a spaceport. Requires a station in communications range.

l control 
a minimum capacity salvage op controller module (contributed by Spatial
Stability)
This is a side module.
This is a salvage op controller, the core module which enables salvage ops to
occur. It has the ability to conduct six salvage ops.
It will use 40 power.
It is not attached to anything.
Its air intake and power feed are properly hooked up.
l second control
a basic control center module (contributed by Suicide Kings)
This is a top module.
Every space station requires a control center, and this is the cheapest one,
providing no complex functions.
It will use 5 power.
It is not attached to anything.

[New Earth; Spaceport Landing Pad]
The busy landing pad of New Earth's capital city's spaceport sits over a large
bay at the tip of the southern continent. The pad itself is a huge square sheet
of white plasteel surrounded by gleaming new starship service structures. On the
southern side of the pad is a circular structure with wide transparisteel
windows affording a fabulous view of the ocean. A softly lit sign over the
transparisteel doorway reads, 'Pilot Lounge,' and a separate doorway is marked
'Liaison Office.' It looks like you can GO into either of those places. To the
west, a bridge spans the gap between the landing pad and the rest of the
spaceport.
There appear to be some people in the lounge.

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[Ventilation Tunnels; Entry Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This appears to be an access point to a space station's large ventilation
system. Though, saying that, it doesn't appear quite large enough for a
battlesuit, and the presence of the heavy powered armor appears to be distending
the metal somewhat. But anything is better than a ventilation system filled with
giant bugs and mold!

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

l
[Ventilation Tunnels; Four-Way Junction] (inside a battlesuit)
Here, a single straight tunnel intersects with another straight tunnel. Through
the magic of topology, this intersection of two things actually creates four
equally exciting paths!
You see the corpse of Bari Vine Cluster Alpha, the corpse of Bari Vine Cluster
Beta, Lily Kaise (League Paladin), Johann Rowan (EAOS Alchemist), Damien
Alexander (Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades), and Cesar Ysidro (RATS Nanite
Integrator) here.
You can go north, east, south, and west.
Cesar Ysidro says in a Chetumal City accent, "Small branch, single mold south
after you go east."
peer n

[Ventilation Tunnels; T-Junction] (inside a battlesuit)
Here, a straight tunnel branches into two alternatives. One can go that way, or
one can go that other way. The possibilities are endless!

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Bari Mold Alpha here.
You can go north and south.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You see Bari Mold Alpha, Lily Kaise (League Paladin), Johann Rowan (EAOS
Alchemist), Cesar Ysidro (RATS Nanite Integrator), and Damien Alexander
(Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades) here.
You can go north and west.
Cesar Ysidro (RATS Nanite Integrator) prepares to use Nanoblade!
Bari Mold Alpha prepares to use Bari Minor Mold Acid!

Bari Mold Alpha!

fires!
   The harpoon strikes Bari Mold Alpha and explodes!

rifle at Bari Mold Alpha and fires!
   A rapid-fire series of bullets impacts Bari Mold Alpha! Four hits!

Alpha!
   Bari Mold Alpha begins taking damage!

(RATS Nanite Integrator), and Damien Alexander (Mutuality Jack-of-all-Trades)
begin taking damage!

peer w
You peer west...
[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.
You can go east and south.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

[Ventilation Tunnels; Hallway] (inside a battlesuit)
The rectangular ventilation shaft continues further in the same direction. It's
amazing to see what gets sucked up by an average station's ventilation system
while cycling its air. Endless bits of paper and trash, children's toys, coins
-- how? currency has been electronic for hundreds of years! -- objects that may
once have been food, gloves, socks, condoms... you name it, it's probably in
here somewhere! And the bugs. Always the bugs.

l
[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
This roomy, circular lounge sits on the very lip of the landing pad outside,
with half of it suspended over the water below. Large transparisteel windows
overlook the ocean at one end and afford a great view of the landing pad at the
other, the material tinting itself automatically when needed. The walls, tables,
and floor are gleaming white lucite, kept immaculately clean by tiny drones that
zip around with automated efficiency. A row of couches face toward the windows,
leaving a relatively open section in the middle of the room. The news broadcast
flickers across the surface of each sleek white table to keep the pilots
informed of the latest goings-on. A stairway towards the back of the room has
its door open and bears a sign reading 'Garage'.
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
You can go out.

[General Communication] Alko Delovega transmits, "Let's go for some!"
[General Communication] Johann Rowan transmits, "Oh cesar. Where are you?"
[General Communication] Damien Alexander transmits, "Depends on what tiers we'll
need an' how soon we get goin'."
[General Communication] Cesar Ysidro transmits, "Still on Inferior Earth."
[General Communication] Alko Delovega transmits, "2 fringe and AEU."
You feel a faint rumbling and look up just in time to see the two-person Accord
gemini "Buttered On The Wrong Side" lift off the landing pad and head into
space.

[General Communication] Johann Rowan transmits, "I'm headed back there."

deploy
You press a prominent button, and a crane promptly retrieves a League
Infantryman from spaceport storage and sets it in front of you.
enter
You press a button on a League Infantryman, which splits open down the front.
You carefully climb inside.
A technician gives your suit a once-over, then nods. "Everything looks good. If
you've got a mission ready to go, you can LAUNCH when ready."
commands
Combat/Support
Command                                                Function
yel....................................................Yellow Glyph       
(Projects a yellow glyph.)
red....................................................Red Glyph          
(Projects a red glyph.)
dsp....................................................Dispel Glyph       
(Dispels all friendly glyphs.)
rep....................................................Repair Drone       
(repair drone)
cover..................................................Move Into/Out of Cover
General
Command                                                Function
launch.................................................Launch To/From Mission
Area
damage.................................................View Damage
weapons................................................View Weapons/Ammo
equip/unequip..........................................Manage Modular Equipment
enter..................................................Transfer to Empty
Battlesuit/Vehicle
exit...................................................Exit Battlesuit/Vehicle
contact................................................Contact Aerial Fortress
(only possible at certain locations)

[New Earth; Pilot Lounge]
You see a semi-circular bar, a public holovid, a brightly-lit candy vending
machine, and a shiny chrome trash bin here.
Alko Delovega, Karasi Valhannon, and Damien Alexander are standing here.
You can go out.
hold alko
You hold Alko Delovega's hand, taking him into your group.
hold damien
You hold Damien Alexander's hand, taking him into your group.
wave 
You wave.
Damien Alexander waves.
Damien Alexander takes a bite of a flaky iced pastry with blueberry filling.
hold karasi
You hold Karasi Valhannon's hand, taking her into your group.
'Waiting on Lily. She wanted to come too.
You say, "Waiting on Lily. She wanted to come too."
'She's almost ready
You say, "She's almost ready."
Karasi Valhannon nods.
A sanitation drone lumbers into the area.
Damien Alexander nods.
Damien Alexander finishes off a flaky iced pastry with blueberry filling.
A sanitation drone briefly emits a mechanical rumbling that sounds much like a
groan, then extends a broom attachment and sweeps the area.
-drone Want to come on a nest/
You say to a sanitation drone, "Want to come on a nest?"
Damien licks blueberry filling off his fingers. "I really should order those
more often."
[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has gained 2,755,616.19 credits
for a submission from a battle analysis scanner on League Battle-Scanning
Nuclear Temporary Station involving the two-person missile corvette "Duet
Allegrezza".
Karasi Valhannon grins at Damien Alexander.
-drone You shall lead us to victory.

Karasi says to Damien, "They are very good."
Karasi Valhannon says in a Martian accent, "I need a pastry and baked goods
machine."

tra 1 Almost ready, Lily?

Lily Kaise just arrived.

grin

post in OOC/Messages To The Not-Staff.

cheese.
'everyone ready?

enter lidia
[Starship "Lidia's Pride"; Control Room]
You see a black leather captain's chair and a gold destination finder here.
You can go south and out.
Alko Delovega, Damien Alexander, Karasi Valhannon, and Lily Kaise followed you.
power
You grasp a large lever on the control board and push it slowly away from you.
Status lights blink on all around you as faint hums and beeps begin to emanate
from the various starship systems.
luanch

launch
You use the ship's radio to ask flight control for launch clearance.
A voice comes over the speaker and says, "Lidia's Pride, you have clearance to
launch. Good luck and come back to us safely."
Damien Alexander asks in a Tenosque accent, "Weapons rooms or fighters?"
'weapons rooms
You say, "Weapons rooms."
Karasi Valhannon nods.
Karasi Valhannon ambles south.
Damien Alexander tramps south.
Alko Delovega asks in a rural Chetumalian accent, "Should I go, or you will?"
'Hmmm, where's a good place for nests now-a-days?
You ask, "Hmmm, where's a good place for nests now-a-days?"
Alko Delovega says in a rural Chetumalian accent, "Ok."
Alko Delovega shrugs.
l
[Starship "Lidia's Pride"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. Lights
overhead indicate that the ship is on green status. Looking through the windows,
you see that the ship is in space.
You see a black leather captain's chair and a gold destination finder here.
Alko Delovega and Lily Kaise are standing here.

launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[RATS Nest; Drop Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This is just inside a location where the nest is open to space. Before you
extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.
You can go east.
peer e
You peer east...
[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.
You can go east and west.

burst of thrust, then hitting the ground and immediately peeling open, revealing
Karasi Valhannon (League Hoplite).

[Aerial Fortress "Stellar Haven"; Deployment] (inside a battlesuit)
The aerial fortress appears to be hovering just inside the entrance of a RATS
nest.
You can go north, northeast, and northwest.
You rocket through the fortress's entrance hatch and stumble to a stop on the
deck.
exit
You tongue a control inside your battlesuit, which immediately splits down the
front. You carefully climb out.

enter
You press a button on a League Infantryman, which splits open down the front.
You carefully climb inside.
launch
You tongue a prominent control inside your battlesuit, then brace yourself as
two halves of a drop pod suddenly descend onto you and seal around you. A moment
later, you feel sudden acceleration as your pod is launched from the aerial
fortress.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
The pod shudders violently as it speeds through the interior of the enemy
structure. The interior of your battlesuit cushions most of the turbulence.
(20 seconds roundtime.)
[Notification from Starseekers] The organization has gained 2,755,616.19 credits
for a submission from a battle analysis scanner on League Battle-Scanning
Nuclear Temporary Station involving the two-person missile corvette "Duet
Allegrezza".
With a sudden burst of thrust, the drop pod slows abruptly. There is another
thud as it impacts a surface, then the walls are suddenly peeling back, freeing
you.
[RATS Nest; Drop Point] (inside a battlesuit)
This is just inside a location where the nest is open to space. Before you
extends a series of tunnels, which are strangely organic-looking, yet clearly
crafted from metal.
You see Karasi Valhannon (League Hoplite), Alko Delovega (Fringe Hunter), Damien
Alexander (AEU Combat Auxiliary), and Lily Kaise (Fringe Hunter) here.
You can go east.

generation.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.

(League Hoplite), Lily Kaise (Fringe Hunter), Alko Delovega (Fringe Hunter), and
Damien Alexander (AEU Combat Auxiliary) here.

[RATS Nest Interior] (inside a battlesuit)
This is the interior of the nest. There is no light here save that provided by
battlesuit torches. Tunnels twist here and there, many too small for you to
navigate. The walls possess a manufactured regularity, while the layout seems
organic and unpredictable. The tunnel abruptly narrows here in a guarded
chokepoint.
You see the wreckage of Miniaturized Interfacing Companion Entity Alpha, the
wreckage of Miniaturized Interfacing Companion Entity Beta, Alko Delovega
(Fringe Hunter), Karasi Valhannon (League Hoplite), Damien Alexander (AEU Combat
Auxiliary), Lily Kaise (Fringe Hunter), a space-grade detonator, two of a chunk
of a RATS nest defender, a portion of a RATS deep space battery, an energy
bottle, a chunk of a RATS nest defender, and two of a small pile of
half-synthesized metals here.
You can go southeast and northwest.

[Starship "William Dove"; Control Room]
The control room is the hub of every starship. Large metal conduits protect
thick bundles of wires carrying information from every part of the ship to this
one location. A large transparisteel viewport provides a view out the front of
the ship, but experienced pilots in space will have eyes only for the large
starmap dominating the right side of the room. Standing before the viewport is
the main control board, providing essential functions like the shipwide power
lever and alert status. Secondary control boards can be pulled up and folded
back to provide a working surface, or pulled down from recesses overhead as
needed. Though the room is spacious enough for a few others to sit or stand, the
entire architecture of the room is built around the small space before the
control board and the person who will stand there: the starship's pilot. The
status lights overhead are currently not receiving power. Looking through the
windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor; Docking Bay.
You see a sleek metal quantum entanglement communication device, a rattan floor
lamp with a light purple lotus shade (casting a white-colored glow), a wormhole
drive tracer, a dark purple leather captain's chair, a large oval white and
black cloth rug, a rare black EAOSian contoured couch with a hand-made white and
sapphire star quilt on it, a glossy purple ceramic felo chow bowl, a wall-sized
bubbling neon purple-lit aquarium containing yellow and violet aquatic life and
coral rocks, a small yellow ball containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, a
small white trash bin, an insulated green cooler, a photo of Aria VII; Dome, a
round white rattan coffee table with a glass top, a clear plastic food storage
container, and Purr the humanoid service robot here.

l lily
Lily Kaise
She appears to be 27 years old. She is about five feet and two inches tall and
has fair skin. Her body is thin with attractively curved hips and shapely
calves. She has slender shoulders and slightly larger than average breasts. Her
face is oval and pretty, with a delicate nose and understated chin. Her lips are
lovely and blush pink and occasionally part to reveal a set of pretty teeth.
Beneath a set of arched eyebrows, her eyes are blue-green and almond-shaped. Her
waist-length, straight hair is pale honey blonde and swept up into a thick fall
of loose curls down her back. She has oval pink fingernails.
A small enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her left earlobe and a small
enameled cerulean blue dragonfly pierces her right earlobe.
 She is wearing a long-sleeved dark blue tee appliqued with small neon purple
flowers, a pair of tight white denim jeans with a small dark-red 'XX'
embroidered on the back left pocket, and a pair of sparkly white leather clogs.
She is also wearing an orange and white blessed prayer bracelet around her
wrist, a slender bracelet of tiny tinkling silver bells around her wrist, a neon
purple wrist-mounted chronometer, a solid silver ring engraved with dragonflies,
a delicate ring of silver wire and small purple amethyst crystals, a metallic
gold touch einrophone in a metallic purple reinforced plastic phone holster, and
a soft fuchsia Tardick lizard snuggly labeled 'Asteria'. Her head, face, both
eyes, neck, both wrists, and both hands are left uncovered.
She is carrying nothing.

40 of the extra metals I had on hand."

[Mining Site (2, -1)]
This is a broad, unforgiving expanse of jagged rock and regolith. Lights shining
brightly from the nearby asteroid outpost are all that keep the surface from
being in total darkness. The light forms shadows with sharp edges, highlighting
every boulder and dangerous peak.
You see a central coordinator here.
There are 27 units of metal here.

and out of the virtual environment.

l
[Starship "William Dove"; Living Quarters One]
This is a small room designed to give crew members a place to sleep while on
long journeys, and it isn't large enough to do much else. A long counter is
bolted to the wall opposite the entryway, and two narrow bunks have been bolted
to the two remaining walls. A small keypad is next to the door, controlling a
simple lock. The status lights overhead are currently not receiving power.
Looking through the windows, you see that the ship is at Old Frontier Processor;
Docking Bay.
You see a glossy sapphire blue ceramic felo chow bowl, a white four poster
rattan bed with a heart-shaped headboard and filmy deep purple hangings with a
set of lavender silk sheets, a soft periwinkle cashmere blanket, a hand-made
purple and amethyst flower quilt, a large periwinkle bed pillow, and a large
periwinkle bed pillow on it, a large oval dark purple and light purple cloth
rug, a small oval turquoise rattan table with a glass top, a small yellow ball
containing a realistic Bari horde noisemaker, and a compact red refrigerator
here.
Lily Kaise is dozing on a white four poster rattan bed.
You can go out.
(You are lying on Lily Kaise.)
